Selected Answer: C
By dragging and dropping the Threat Activity view to the top of the navigation page in the Edit Navigation settings, you make it the default landing page when users access Splunk Enterprise Security. This method sets the order of views and determines which page is shown first.

Selected Answer: B
Answer: B click the "Set this as the default view"
Correct answer is B
B - ES Admin 7 - page 141

comments.content: By dragging to the tap of the page, you only add it to the menu bar. That does not make it default landing page. You have to click the check mark "Set this as the default view". B is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct, you drag the view to the top of the page, under the "Home" block/group

choices.C: From the Edit Navigation page, drag and drop the Threat Activity view to the top of the page.
choices.A: Edit the Threat Activity view settings and checkmark the Default View option.
choices.B: From the Edit Navigation page, click the "Set this as the default view" checkmark for Threat Activity.
choices.D: From the Preferences menu for the user, select Enterprise Security as the default application.

Selected Answer: B
Follow these steps to automatically create a 6 digit short ID to identify a notable:
1. In Enterprise Security, navigate to the Incident Review page.
2. Expand the notable to which you want to add a short ID.
3. Scroll to Event Details and click Create Short ID.
A 6 digit alpha-numeric hash short ID is automatically created for the notable.
Answer B - ES Admin 7 page 352
Slide 352 "Create a Short ID from Event Details" in Administering Splunk Enterprise Security 7.X
